meanings.definition: To come to the surface again.
meanings.sent1: After the storm, the sun made the colorful fish resurface in the pond.
meanings.sent2: The bubbles caused by the diver's movements made the treasure chest resurface.
meanings.sent3: The magician made the coin resurface in an unexpected place, surprising the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her memories of childhood would resurface like bubbles in a fizzy drink, sudden and effervescent.
meanings.sent5: The truth always finds a way to resurface, like a determined swimmer coming up for air.

meanings.definition: To appear again after a period of absence.
meanings.sent1: The stars resurface in the night sky after the passing of the clouds.
meanings.sent2: After years of silence, his old friend finally resurfaced with a phone call.
meanings.sent3: The missing sock decided to resurface in the laundry basket, much to everyone's relief.
meanings.sent4: His childhood fears resurfaced like ghosts in the dark, haunting his dreams.
meanings.sent5: The forgotten memories resurfaced in her mind like old photographs, vivid and nostalgic.

meanings.definition: To repair or replace the surface of something.
meanings.sent1: The workers will resurface the road to make it smooth and safe for driving.
meanings.sent2: It's time to resurface the old wooden table to give it a fresh look.
meanings.sent3: The artist decided to resurface the canvas with a new layer of paint, transforming the artwork.
meanings.sent4: She needed to resurface the swimming pool to fix the cracks and leaks.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter will resurface the floorboards to restore the beauty of the old house.
